# Documentation

This website is documentation for the MonoLISA architectural pattern.
To understand MonoLISA, read the `docs` folder.
The intended audience is software engineers and software architects.

## General Guidelines
- Use simple language.
- Use short sentences.
- Use active voice, where the subject performs the action.
- Use present tense verbs (is, open) instead of past tense (was, opened).
- Use second person (you) to speak directly to readers.
- Use words and phrases that resonate with software engineers.
- Include examples and analogies where applicable.
- Generate diagrams where applicable.
